pullRequest.body:
This PR is a preparation for follow-up work on Lie's theorem.

In the proof of Lie's theorem, there are a number of different ways to infer bracket actions,
and not all of them allowed rewriting by the `leibniz_lie` lemma.
So the proof would be massaging terms of Lie ideals into terms of the ambient Lie algebra, etc...

By abstracting this lemma, and providing suitable instances,
we can now simply rewrite with `leibniz_lie` without the massaging.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [0ca35633dd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20403/commits/0ca35633dd706bd14f80e4083cccb046f7e5a9c5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsLieTower`
`+ instance (I : LieIdeal R L) : IsLieTower I L M`
`+ instance (I : LieIdeal R L) : IsLieTower L I M`
`+ instance : Bracket L' M`
`+ instance : IsLieTower L L M`
`+ instance : IsLieTower L' L M`
`+ lie_swap_lie`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
This looks like a clever way to simplify things later on.
This looks like a clever way to simplify things later on.

nit:
```suggestion
  protected leibniz_lie (x : L₁) (y : L₂) (m : M) : ⁅x, ⁅y, m⁆⁆ = ⁅⁅x, y⁆, m⁆ + ⁅y, ⁅x, m⁆⁆
```

Rewriting as
```lean
⁅⁅x, y⁆, m⁆ = ⁅x, ⁅y, m⁆⁆ - ⁅y, ⁅x, m⁆⁆
```
I guess in a bundled spelling this says
```lean
lieAct ⁅x, y⁆ = ⁅lieAct x, lieAct y⁆
```
where I assume `lieAct` exists somewhere. Does this sound correct? Do we have this bundling or this theorem anywhere?

(this might also be an argument for `⁅⁅x, y⁆, m⁆ = ⁅x, ⁅y, m⁆⁆ - ⁅y, ⁅x, m⁆⁆` being the more natural phrasing of the definition; I would guess that avoiding `-` in the definition just increases the chance of the definition being wrong on semirings)

I think we should stick with the axiom as it stands (I touched on these issues in section 2 [here](https://arxiv.org/abs/2112.04570) ages ago).

I also think we should use this new class in the definition of `LieRing` and `LieRingModule`. E.g., we should be able to drop the explicit `leibniz_lie` axioms from these by extending as follows:
```lean
class LieRing (L : Type v) extends AddCommGroup L, Bracket L L, LieTower L L L where
...
```

Just to answer @eric-wieser explicitly: what you call `lieAct` above, is essentially [LieModule.toEnd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Lie/OfAssociative.html#LieModule.toEnd) (except with some redundant bundled assumptions). Actually this uses an instance which I'd like to demote to a def, namely [LieRing.ofAssociativeRing](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Lie/OfAssociative.html#LieRing.ofAssociativeRing) and demote `LieModule.toEnd` to a plain linear map, and basically follow the plan outlined ages ago on Zulip [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Lie.20bracket.20vs.20commutator.20diamond/near/444854169)

I also think we should try to shorten the doc string. The main point is that the `leibniz_lie` axioms in this new class allows three carrier types / three bracket actions (unlike the extant versions in `LieRing`, `LieRingModule` which allow only 1, 2 resp).

> I also think we should use this new class in the definition of `LieRing` and `LieRingModule`. E.g., we should be able to drop the explicit `leibniz_lie` axioms from these by extending as follows:

I'm unsure about this one, this feels a bit lie deciding to make `Semigroup M` extend `IsScalarTower M M M`, which while correct might be a bit silly. Maybe the fact that the notation is actually identical here means it isn't a problem.

I've processed all comments except for the ones in this thread, because I feel like the requests here are in tension with each other.

- I agree with @ocfnash that I think we should keep the current form of the axiom.
- I don't have an opinion about whether we use this in `LieRing` and `LieRingModule` already. I think we could experiment with that in a follow-up PR, and keep this one minimally invasive.
- I'm happy to shorten the docstring, but I think this longer one doesn't hurt either. Since "Lie tower" isn't an established concept, I thought it would be good to explain it with some examples to help future readers (including me).

```suggestion
instance instLieRingModule : LieRingModule L' M where
```
I've removed the name instead (also elsewhere) since the autogenerated names are pretty good these days.

I've reverted the commit about this name change. It cascades into fixing other files, and there are many names like this. (I'm only moving this instance.)
I propose we fix this in the entire Lie theory folder in a separate PR.

How would you feel about:
```suggestion
class IsLieTower (L₁ L₂ M : Type*) [Bracket L₁ L₂] [Bracket L₁ M] [Bracket L₂ M] [Add M] where
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Lie): add `LieTower` typeclass abstracting the Leibniz rule
